thread.title: Red tape still exists for Americans while visiting CubaTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Red tape still exists for Americans while visiting CubaTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Red tape still exists for Americans while visiting Cuba Published on : Saturday, September 19, 2015
Despite the U.S. moving on Friday to ease travel and other restrictions to Cuba, Americans will still not be allowed to go to the Communist nation for “tourismt activities,” a U.S. official said.
Speaking to reporters, senior Obama administration officials said such travel remains prohibited even as the regulations expand to allow family members to travel alongside authorized travellers for a wider variety of activities.
Overall, the U.S. officials also said that the full impact of latest easing of all Cuba restrictions will depend on whether the Cuban government makes reforms, including on imports.
Asked about the banking rules, U.S. officials said it was up to Havana to decide what currency they would allow for such transactions to those authorized travellers allowed to open accounts in Cuba,.
